image.altText: A man wearing a pale blue business shirt and navy tie walks with a stern expression.

items.synopsis: Lawyers for Zachary Rolfe have asked the Northern Territory coroner to "consider recusing herself" from an inquest into the death of Kumanjayi Walker "on the grounds of apprehended bias".

title.children: Zachary Rolfe asks NT coroner to consider stepping aside from Kumanjayi Walker inquest

image.altText: Three Palestinian men in orange hi-vis vests stand beside and on the smoking wreckage of a building and car.

items.synopsis: Since Saturday's surprise assault, Israeli aircraft have been pounding Gaza targets while its ground forces have battled to retake control of border villages and towns overrun by Palestinian gunmen.

title.children: 'We are going on the offensive': Israel to blockade Gaza as reservists called up en masse — as it happened

image.altText: Composite picture

items.synopsis: Young rave attendees set out to a southern Israel desert for two days of fun and music. What greeted them was a horror surprise attack that killed hundreds.

title.children: Inside the Israeli festival of 'good news' where hundreds were murdered

image.altText: A police officer stands on a road in front of a police vehicle within a park

items.synopsis: Emergency services were called to the scene at 1pm on Sunday following reports two people had been struck by a large tree branch.

title.children: Woman killed by falling tree branch in Darwin a South African national, police say

image.altText: Smoke rises above apartment buildings.

items.synopsis: The situation in Israel is unpredictable and changing quickly, but one of the few certainties is that Israel will respond ferociously. This crisis is almost certain to get much worse before it gets better, writes John Lyons.

title.children: The Hamas attack creates a dilemma for Israel, which is facing its most serious crisis in decades

image.altText: A close-up photo of John Howard pointing to an audience, with Australian flags in the background

items.synopsis: Former prime minister John Howard says the Northern Territory government has failed to provide adequate police, health and education services in the 15 years since the Intervention. But a political expert has labelled those comments a "partisan swipe".

title.children: John Howard's criticism of the NT government dismissed as political 'point-scoring'

image.altText: People support woman injured with crowd behind them

items.synopsis: 100,000 Israeli reserve troops have gathered in southern Israel to wrest control from Hamas militants, in response to their surprise attack from the Gaza strip.

title.children: 'No electricity, no food, no water': Israel vows to impose 'total blockade' on Gaza

image.altText: Former NT politician Shane Stone looking serious while standing in front of NT Parliament House.

items.synopsis: Shane Stone is elected unopposed by the Country Liberal Party’s rank-and-file as president, 10 months out from the next territory election.

title.children: Ex-NT chief minister elected as new Country Liberal Party president as election race ramps up

image.altText: Sheikh Ibrahim Dadoun speaks to a crowd

items.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong says the targeting of civilians and taking of hostages was "never a cause for celebration", with Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton joining in the criticism of a gathering in the southern suburb of Lakemba.

title.children: 'Barbaric attacks': Peter Dutton joins Anthony Albanese and Penny Wong in slamming pro-Palestinian rally in Sydney

image.altText: An oil pump sits idle against an orange sky.

items.synopsis: The war coincided with an oil supply shortage and led to a massive spike in the price of crude oil.

title.children: ‘Very worrying’: Motorists should brace for a surge in petrol prices and higher interest rates, analysts warn

image.altText: Tom Robinson with parents at Brisbane Airport

items.synopsis: Everyone at Brisbane Airport was eager to hear how Tom Robinson is faring following his brush with death, but his only focus now is family.

title.children: 'Good to be alive': Rower rescued from flipped vessel in Pacific Ocean returns home

image.altText: A photo of a middle-aged woman sits to the left of a blue slide with white writing and a golden Nobel insignia.

items.synopsis: It follows the official Nobel Prizes in medicine, physics, chemistry, literature and peace that were announced last week.

title.children: Harvard professor Claudia Goldin awarded Nobel economics prize for work on labour market gender gap

image.altText: A woman in a 'DISRUPT BURRUP HUB' T-shirt stands in the street with her arms raised

items.synopsis: The battle over the climate is escalating, and nowhere more than in Western Australia, where a new generation of protesters is prepared to break the law to make their point.

title.children: Climate protesters targeted an oil and gas CEO at her home. This is the inside story of what happened

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair and dark glasses.

items.synopsis: Angie Fuller, a 30-year-old mother of two, was last seen near Alice Springs in January. Her disappearance is being treated as a homicide.

title.children: NT Police offer $250k reward for information on disappearance, suspected killing of Angie Fuller

image.altText: Coffs Harbour Airport fire

items.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology has just released its outlook for the coming season, detailing the risk of tropical cyclones, floods, heatwaves, fires and storms.

title.children: 'Unusually warm temperatures until next year': Heatwave and bushfire alert for eastern Australia

image.altText: A wide shot showing the top of a rock shelter in the foreground, with bushes and shrubs stretching across a desert landscape.

items.synopsis: Traditional owners say an ancient rock shelter in WA's north is in a "fragile state" and was impacted by Rio Tinto's blasting, despite the company concluding it had suffered "no structural damage" as a result of the explosions.

title.children: Traditional owners say rock shelter impacted by Rio Tinto blasting as miner finds 'no structural damage'

image.altText: A mid-shot of Cheryl Kickett-Tucker

items.synopsis: More than a century ago Cheryl Kickett-Tucker's great-grandfather fought for his Indigenous children to be allowed to attend the local school. Decades later Cheryl, an academic and volunteer for Indigenous youth, is walking in his footsteps.

title.children: My great-grandfather fought for his people. Now I'm walking in his footsteps

image.altText: A shirtless man with dreadlocks leans on a van in the desert and plays a guitar.

items.synopsis: A coroner finds that Travis Cashmore intentionally shot two men and drove over their bodies with his van before taking his life in Victoria last year.

title.children: A lottery ticket and a smile led up to double murder, shooter's death, inquest confirms

image.altText: man and woman arguing on couch, close up of hands

items.synopsis: Gaslighting is a very real and dangerous pattern of behaviour, but social media doesn't always portray it correctly.

title.children: What does gaslighting mean — and is overuse of the term trivialising it?

image.altText: A man wearing a cowboy had watches a rodeo in action.

items.synopsis: A rodeo horse was euthanased at an event in north-west Victoria after an incident organisers say would have been upsetting for spectators.

title.children: Mum reduced to tears after seeing horse break leg in 'freak' rodeo incident

image.altText: a woman in bed with an eye mask on, sleeping

items.synopsis: If the global insomnia market is anything to go by, insomnia is big business and getting bigger. How did we become so obsessed with sleep, asks Philippa Martyr.

title.children: A short history of insomnia and how we became obsessed with sleep

image.altText: A plane flying over New Farm, in Brisbane

items.synopsis: Three major airlines will be able to fly more often over Moreton Bay in a move Brisbane Airport says will reduce aircraft noise over the city.

title.children: Brisbane Airport launches flight path change to cut city noise

image.altText: Composite image of Taylor Adams, Ben McKay and Brodie Grundy.

items.synopsis: The Ben McKay saga continues without conclusion on the opening day of AFL trade period, while Essendon eye more big-name recruits and Lachie Schultz requests a move to Collingwood.

title.children: Bombers make their McKay move and lock in Goldstein, Schultz stuns Freo with trade request

image.altText: A group of glum-looking Australian rugby union players stand around on the pitch after losing a big game.

items.synopsis: Former Test captain Stephen Moore says rugby in Australia needs an overhaul to stop the Wallabies becoming a tier two team following their World Cup flop.

title.children: Former skipper Stephen Moore fears Wallabies could become second tier rugby nation

image.altText: Close up shot of a woman of middle-eastern appearance in sunset light on a beach

items.synopsis: Elahe Yazdani says she was forced to induce her baby in 2020, with little English and less communication from hospital staff, and she still carries the trauma from her childbirth experience.

title.children: 'I didn't want to have it': Iranian refugee details terror of 'forced' induction at NSW hospital, inquiry told

image.altText: Woman with brown hair and a fringe wearing black-rim glasses sits looking serious at a laptop

items.synopsis: A cruel and incurable disease took former TV personality Fiona MacDonald's voice, and her trademark quick wit and banter with it. But she's not staying silent.

title.children: 'There is no treatment, no cure': Why Fiona MacDonald is making every second count

image.altText: A photo of a womans chest with a black shirt and jacket

items.synopsis: Federal public servants tend to earn less than other Australians who are the same age and who have similar educational achievements, ABC analysis shows.

title.children: How much is a public servant worth? Data suggests it's more than they are paid

image.altText: A side by side image of a father dressed in a hat and a son dressed in a suit

items.synopsis: Two men killed in light plane crash at Merriton in regional South Australia have been identified as father and son Ben and Charlie Mumford.

title.children: Father and son killed in light plane crash in regional SA

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Deputy Premier of Victoria Jacinta Allan speaks to media during a press conference.

items.synopsis: The evidence presented to the inquiry into the cancellation of the Commonwealth Games casts some doubt over Jacinta Allan's claim she only knew of cost blowouts in the weeks leading up to the event being cancelled.

title.children: More details of Commonwealth Games cost blowouts emerge in Victorian inquiry hearings

image.altText: Ambulance driving on an unidentified road.

items.synopsis: A Tasmanian coroner has found the ambulance service failed to correctly prioritise a case where a man was showing multiple heart attack symptoms.

title.children: Wife called triple-0 when husband suffered heart attack but dispatchers didn't send ambulance, coroner finds

image.altText: two AFP officers lead a man in handcuffs

items.synopsis: Five men are under arrest, including two baggage handlers after the AFP uncovered an alleged cocaine smuggling ring in the cargo bay of a Sydney-bound plane.

title.children: Two Sydney baggage handlers charged over cocaine importation plot
